ygData.subject: Re: building Cantera on linux
ygData.msgSnippet: Dave, I just tried to compile cantera(from cvs) on linux with gcc 4.1 and found some problems which you might interested in ;) First error:

Dave,

I just tried to compile cantera(from cvs) on linux with gcc 4.1 and
=
found some problems which you might interested in ;) 

First error: 
Lattic=
eSolidPhase.h:74: error: extra qualification
`Cantera::LatticeSolidPhase::'=
 on member `setLatticeMoleFractions'

this could be easily solved by: 
void=
 LatticeSolidPhase::setLatticeMoleFractions(int n,
        string x);
to:

=
void setLatticeMoleFractions(int n,
        string x);

The second error:

best =

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote=
:
>
> I found the source of my earlier problem.  It was just a path  
> pro=
blem. I was compiling with g++ 4.0.2, but was trying to link to an  
> earl=
ier version of the stdc++ library.  When I put in the correct  
> path to t=
he 4.0.2 libraries (by specifying LCXX_FLAGS in the  
> 'preconfig' script)=
, Cantera built fine, and the demos work.
> 
> So, as far as I know, there =
are no problems with building Cantera on  
> linux.  The latest version of =
Cantera (available only through CVS)  
> should also correctly link to sund=
ials 2.2.0.
> 
> Dave
>
